data.name: CredentialOrganizationIdMessage
data.value: -Credential parameter can only be used with Organization ID credentials. For more information, please refer to http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=331007&clcid=0x409 for more information about the difference between an organizational account and a Microsoft account.

data.value: Your Microsoft Azure credential in the Windows PowerShell session has expired. Please log in again. In PowerShell, execute Connect-AzAccount.

data.value: Multiple tokens were found for this user. Please clear your token cache using, Clear-AzureProfile and try this command again.

data.name: AdalUserInteractionRequired
data.value: User Interaction is required to authenticate this user. Please authenticate using the log in dialog. In PowerShell, execute Connect-AzAccount.

data.name: TenantNotFound
data.value: No tenant was found for this subscription. Please execute Clear-AzureProfile and then execute Add-AzureAccount.

data.name: NoAccountInContext
data.value: [Common.Authentication]: No matching account record for account {0} in subscription {1}

data.name: NoEnvironmentInContext
data.value: [Common.Authentication]: No matching environment record for environment {0} in subscription {1}, using AzureCloud environment instead

data.name: AuthenticatingForSingleTenant
data.value: [Common.Authentication]: Authenticating for account {0} with single tenant {1}

data.name: ArmAccountNotFound
data.value: No account found in the context. Please login using Connect-AzAccount.

data.name: ArmUserInteractionRequired
data.value: User Interaction is required to authenticate this user. Please execute Connect-AzAccount without parameters and enter your credentials.

data.name: InvalidArmContext
data.value: Your Azure credentials have not been set up or have expired, please run Connect-AzAccount to set up your Azure credentials.

data.name: NoSubscriptionInContext
data.value: No subscription found in the context. Please ensure that the credentials you provided are authorized to access an Azure subscription, then run Connect-AzAccount to login.

data.name: NoTenantInContext
data.value: No tenant found in the context. Please ensure that the credentials you provided are authorized to access an Azure subscription, then run Connect-AzAccount to login.

data.name: UnsupportedCredentialType
data.value: Certificate authentication is not supported for account type {0}.

data.name: InvalidGraphTokenAudience
data.value: No value was specified for the token audience for the graph endpoint in environment '{0}'. Please use Set-AzEnvironment -Name {0} -GraphAudience token-audience-value

data.name: InvalidManagementTokenAudience
data.value: No value was specified for the token audience for the management endpoint in environment '{0}'. Please use Set-AzEnvironment -Name {0} -ActiveDirectoryServiceEndpointResourceId token-audience-value

data.name: TokenIssuerTrace
data.value: [Common.Authentication]: Parsed token '{0}' with json value '{1}' and decoded issuer '{2}'.

data.name: AccessTokenResourceNotFound
data.value: Cannot retrieve access token for resource '{0}'. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.

data.name: MSITokenRequestFailed
data.value: There was an error retrieving the managed service access token for resource '{0}' using the URI '{1}'. Please check that this managed service is configured to emit tokens at this address and that the associated managed service identity has the appropriate role assignment and try logging in again.

data.name: TryLaunchBrowser
data.value: Attempting to launch a browser for authorization code login.

data.name: UnableToLaunchBrowser
data.value: Unable to launch a browser for authorization code login. Reverting to device code login.

data.name: AutosaveNotSupportedWithSuggestion
data.value: Context autosave is not supported on current environment. Please disable it using 'Disable-AzContextSave'.

data.name: MissingPasswordAndNoCache
data.value: Password is missing and no cache found for the current user.

data.name: FailedToMigrateAdal2Msal
data.value: INITIALIZATION: Failed to migrate ADAL token to MSAL token with error : {0}

data.name: HelpMessageOfDefaultSubscriptionForLogin
data.value: Subscription name or GUID. Sets the default context for Azure PowerShell when logging in without specifying a subscription.

data.name: HelpMessageOfEnableInterceptSurvey
data.value: When enabled, you are prompted infrequently to participate in user experience surveys for Azure PowerShell.

data.name: HelpMessageOfDisplayBreakingChangeWarnings
data.value: Controls if warning messages for breaking changes are displayed or suppressed. When enabled, a breaking change warning is displayed when executing cmdlets with breaking changes in a future release.

data.name: HelpMessageOfEnableDataCollection
data.value: When enabled, Azure PowerShell cmdlets send telemetry data to Microsoft to improve the customer experience. For more information, see our privacy statement: https://aka.ms/privacy

data.name: StorageLockConflicts
data.value: AzKeyStore is locked. Please try again after a while.

data.name: SwitchLoginMethodWarning
data.value: You may need to login again after updating "{0}".

data.name: HelpMessageOfEnableWamLogin
data.value: When enabled, Web Account Manager (WAM) will be the default interactive login experience. It will fall back to using the browser if the platform does not support WAM. For more details please refer to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2272007

data.name: RecommendationMessageForLocation
data.value: Selecting “{0}” may reduce your costs. The region you’ve selected may cost more for the same services. You can disable this message in the future with the command “Update-AzConfig -DisplayRegionIdentified $false”. Learn more at https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2225665

data.name: HelpMessageOfDisplayRegionIdentified
data.value: When enabled, Azure PowerShell displays recommendations on regions which may reduce your costs.

data.name: HelpMessageOfEnableErrorRecordsPersistence
data.value: When enabled, error records will be written to ~/.Azure/ErrorRecords.

data.name: HelpMessageOfCheckForUpgrade
data.value: When enabled, Azure PowerShell will check for updates automatically and display a hint message when an update is available. The default value is true.

data.name: FailedToMigrateMsalCacheWithLegayName
data.value: INITIALIZATION: Failed to migrate MSAL token cache of the legacy name with error : {0}

data.name: HelpMessageOfDisplaySecretsWarning
data.value: When enabled, a warning message will be displayed when the cmdlet output contains secrets. Learn more at https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2258844

data.name: DisableInstanceDiscoveryWarning
data.value: Set it to true to disable both instance discovery and authority validation. This functionality is intended for use in scenarios where the metadata endpoint cannot be reached, such as in private clouds or Azure Stack. It is crucial to ensure that the configured authority host is valid and trustworthy.

data.name: HelpMessageOfDisableInstanceDiscovery
data.value: Set it to true to disable both instance discovery and authority validation. This functionality is intended for use in scenarios where the metadata endpoint cannot be reached, such as in private clouds or Azure Stack. The process of instance discovery entails retrieving authority metadata from https://login.microsoft.com/ to validate the authority. By setting this to true, the validation of the authority is disabled. As a result, it is crucial to ensure that the configured authority host is valid and trustworthy.

data.name: HelpMessageOfLoginExperienceV2
data.value: Only active when authenticating interactively, allows the user to choose the subscription and tenant used in subsequent commands. Possible values ad 'On' (Default) and 'Off'. 'On' requires user's input. 'Off' will use the first tenant and subscription returned by Azure, can change without notice and lead to command execution in an unwanted context (not recommended).

data.name: ErrorMessageMsalInteractionRequiredWithTid
data.value: Authentication failed against tenant {0}. User interaction is required. This may be due to the conditional access policy settings such as multi-factor authentication (MFA). If you need to access subscriptions in that tenant, please rerun 'Connect-AzAccount' with additional parameter '-TenantId {0}'.

data.name: ErrorMsgMsalInteractionRequiredWithResourceID
data.value: Authentication failed against resource {0}. User interaction is required. This may be due to the conditional access policy settings such as multi-factor authentication (MFA). Please rerun 'Connect-AzAccount' with additional parameter '-AuthScope {0}'.
